Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Direttore (insieme al Prof.M.Kumm NYU/Humboldt Universitaet) della rivista scientifica internazionale "Jus Cogens: A Critical Journal of Philosophy of Global Law and Politics", Springer Verlag (in fase di approvazione finale)
Membro del comitato scientifico book series on "Philosophy and Human Rights" Value Inquiry Book Series at Brill, diretto da John-Stewart Gordon

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Relazione al convegno “Strategies for the strengthening of the judiciary in Moldova”, at State University of Moldova, Chisinau/EU Commission. Paper presentato: “Role of the Judges in democratic political systems: the Italian case”
Relazione alla conferenza “Pavia Graduate Conference”, University of Pavia. Paper presentato:“Cultural relativism and cosmopolitanism of human rights”

Relatore alla conferenza “Demos: democratic elections motivation, orientation and support”, Delegation of the European Commission to Bangladesh, Dhaka, Bangladesh. Paper presentato: “Elections and democracy: assessing the case of divided societies”.
Relatore alla conferenza “Philosophy and the Social Sciences” Institute of Philosophy, Czech Academy of Sciences, Prague. Paper presentato: “The democratic peace theory. Some critical reflections”.
Relatore al convegno “New Dynamics in comparative law”, Örebro University, Sweden. Paper presentato “Can human rights be exported? The concept of transplantability revisited”.

Relazione alla conferenza annuale “Philosophy and the Social Sciences” Institute of Philosophy, Czech Academy of Sciences, Prague. Paper presentato:Dialectic of recognition: for a post-metaphysical justification of human rights”

Relazione alla conferenza annuale “Philosophy and the Social Sciences” Institute of Philosophy, Czech Academy of Sciences, Prague. Paper presentato: “The truth of justice: counterfactual thinking in transitional justice”.

Relazione al convegno annuale della società italiana di filosofia politica. Paper presentato: “Verità e giustizia: ragionamento controfattuale nella giustizia transizionale”, Roma , Centro studi americani.

Relatore la convegno Fifth International Conference on Applied Ethics, Hokkaido University, Sapporo, Japan. Paper preseentato: “Ethical assessment of pharmacogenomics through deliberation. The DePGX project”.
Relatore al convegno “Truth and Justice. Normative Questions, Political Practices”, State University of Milano. Discussant del paper di R.Teitel “Transitional Justice as Liberal Narrative”
Relatore al Convegno “Philosophy and the Social Sciences” Institute of Philosophy, Czech Academy of Sciences, Prague. Paper presentato: “Pluralism or plural justifications of human rights?”

Relatore alla conferenza biannuale IVR World Congress of Philosophy of Law and Social Philosophy “Law, Science and Technology”, Goethe-Universität, Frankfurt am Main, Germany. Paper presentato: “Dialectics of human rights. A post-metaphysical sketch”.
Organizzatore e relatore nel Panel (Foundations of Political Thought) presso l' APSA Annual Conference, Seattle, WA, USA: participanti: S.Benhabib, R.Forst, R.Teitel, W.Scheuerman, C.Corradetti.

Organizzatore e relatore del Convegno di studi internationale “Patientcentricity: the Ethics of Genetics”, finanziato dal Ministero dell'Educazione e dell'Università all'interno del programma FIRB presso l'Accademia europea di Bolzano.

Relazione di apertura alla conferenza: Südtirolismen II, section on “violence and politic – international contexts”, European Academy, Bolzano/Bozen. Paper presentato: “Transitional Justice and the truth constraints of a (divided) public sphere: stability through deliberation in South Tyrol”.

Relazione presentata alla conferenza annuale “Philosophy and the Social Sciences” Institute of Philosophy, Czech Academy of Sciences, Prague. Titolo paper: “Transitional Justice as Critical Genealogy”.
Relatore al workshop “Per un ampliamento della filosofia dei diritti umani”, University of Milan “Bicocca”, paper presentato: “Diritti umani e azione comunicativa"

Relatore al seminario Monday Lunch Seminars, presso il Norwegian Centre for Human Rights, Faculty of Law, University of Oslo. Paper presentato: “What does cultural difference require of human rights?”.
Organizzatore e relatore di un panel (Human Rights division) presso l' APSA Annual Conference, Chicago, Ill. partecipanti: R.Teitel, B.Leebaw, J.Marko,C.Corradetti.
Relatore al workshop "Justice and Democracy", University of Tromsø, Tromsø, Norway .Paper presentato: “Transitional Times, Reflective Judgment and the ‘Hōs mē’ Condition”.
Relatore alla conferenza “Debating ‘Transitional Cosmopolitanism’ through Courts”, University of Oslo. Paper presentato: “On the very idea of transitional cosmopolitanism through Courts”.

Relatore al convegno “Free Speech, Public Deliberation and Global Affairs”, Tromso, Norway. Paper presentato: “Pluralism, Relativism and the Philosophical Account of Human Rights” paper delivered at the University of Tromso
Organizzatore e relatore della sessione “Debating ‘Transitional Cosmopolitanism’” Mancept Conference, Manchester
Organizzatore e relatore nel ciclo di seminari “Contemporary Debates on Legal and Political Philosophy”, presso il Norwegian Center of Human Rights, University of Oslo, Norway
Organizzatore e relatore nel “The Berlin Workshops” finanziato dal Democracy Fund presso la Humboldt University, Berlino

Relatore (key note speaker) al Convegno su “Emergence, Reproduction and Hegemonization of and by Human Rights Regimes”, German South-East Asian Center of Excellence for Public Policy and Good Governance, Lebua State Tower, Bangkok, Thailand. Paper presentato: “Cosmopolitanism as Constitutional Poliarchies”, Keynote Speaker at the International Conference on

Commentatore al paper di Nancy Fraser “Legitimation Crisis? On the Political Contradictions of Financialized Capitalism”. Seminario organizzato presso il Norwegian Center of Human Rights, University of Oslo.

Organizzatore e relatore del panel “Legal Cosmopolitanism and Critical Theory” (invitati prof.M.Kumm, NYU e B.Milstein, Frankfurt), presso la Conferenza “Philosophy and the Social Sciences” Institute of Philosophy, Czech Academy of Sciences, Prague.

Relatore al convegno mondiale bi-annuale : XXVII World Congress of the International Association for the Philosophy of Law and Social Philosophy (IVR), Washington DC.. Paper presentato: “Cosmopolitan Authority” all'interno dello special workshop su “Transnational Legal Theory”

Relatore al congresso bi-annuale: XXVII World Congress of the International Association for the Philosophy of Law and Social Philosophy (IVR), Washington DC. Paper presentato:  “Apparent Paradoxes in the ‘Militant Turn’ of the European Court of Human Rights. Transitional Rationale and the Refah Partisi Case”,

Organizzatore (con Başak Çalı) e presentatore di paper nel workshop 'The European Court of Human Rights: Promoter or Predator of Democratic Transitions?' presso lo RCAC Building of Koç University, İstiklal Caddesi 181 on 19-20 September, 2015.

Relatore al workshop Towards Perpetual Peace. Politics, Culture and Education, organized by Aarhus Universiteet in Copenhagen. Paper presentato: “Kant’s Cosmopolitanism and the ideal role of the Völkerstaat”
Organizzatore (con il prof. G.Sartor) e speaker del workshop ‘Global Constitutionalism without Global Democracy’ presso l'istituto universitario europeo, Fiesole

Relatore alla conferenza su "International Relations and Human Rights", presso la Nordic Summer School and European Humanities University, at Tallinn University. Paper presentato: “The Contemporary Significance of Kant’s Cosmopolitan Right and its Importance for a Cosmopolitan Constitution” Tallinn, Estonia.
Relatore al colloquium del Centre of global Constitutionalism, Berlino . Relazione: Wissenschaftszentrum Berlin für Sozialforschung, “Global Constitutionalism and Kantian Political Philosophy”.

Relatore presso il workshop “Human Rights – Contemporary Threats and Challenges”, dell'università di Wroclaw, Polonia. Paper presentato: “Democracy Assumptions of the European Court of Human Rights: “Transitional Rationale” and “Militant Democracy” in the Case of Party-Bans”
Relatore al convegno  ICON - N "Borders, Otherness and Public Law" paper presentato:“Kantian Theory of the Cosmopolitan Constitution” Humboldt University, Berlin
Invito come relatore al seminario di J.Nickel “Making Sense of Human Rights”, presso l'università Ca’ Foscari di Venezia.

Partecipazione al convegno "State of Peace Conference 2016 – „EU Action and Global Justice" paper presentato "Transnational trajectories of European judicial contestation: ECtHR and CJEU Versus the UN Security Council"
